channel.title: Question need to be answered
channel.description: Can anyone tell me why we can't have img tags in sigs and why we can't have profile pics. Just curious.

item.title: Question need to be answered
item.dc:creator: @judostar1 judostar1
item.description:
@judostar1 wrote:

[quote=“Jamie1200, post:24, topic:419857”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=522394.msg3799855#msg3799855 date=1319924415]
We can’t have images in signatures, but we’re allowed avatars (assuming because having a scarcity of them doesn’t look too cluttered, and staff can be trusted to not put inappropriate things as avatars?) You’d have to ask MITB to be 100% sure though.
[/quote]
Getting a reply would be like trying to get blood out a stone.[/quote]

or me getting 99 range (p.s. i fucking hate range)

Read full topic

item.title: Question need to be answered

@reyx7 wrote:

Yea if fits within a set box of requirements a non .gif avatar would be ok. Lengthy perameters as for user would need approval.

item.title: Question need to be answered
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

Bandwidth and people advertising servers in their signatures. Staff would have to give out so many more warnings to people.

Read full topic

item.title: Question need to be answered
item.dc:creator: @kwu kwu
item.description:
@kwu wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:419857”]It may just be because Mopar is the first forum I ever used, but I’ve come to despise forums that allow images in signatures, especially ones that allow large images. They look extremely sloppy, immature, and unprofessional. I’ve even implemented the same system on any forum I create/administrate as well.

Avatars don’t bother me as much, and if there was an approval system for who gets them/what they can be I probably wouldn’t care if other users had them as well. I dislike animated avatars though, they get distracting.[/quote]

^ Exactly that. I don’t even want to know how many images in my adblock filter are from overly large images in sigs, or flashy annoying images… and content that…is questionable. I enjoy looking at signatures, but too many of them are annoying. :|.

ps; Hi david, I have been stalking you and a few other people

Read full topic

item.title: Question need to be answered
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

It may just be because Mopar is the first forum I ever used, but I’ve come to despise forums that allow images in signatures, especially ones that allow large images. They look extremely sloppy, immature, and unprofessional. I’ve even implemented the same system on any forum I create/administrate as well.

Avatars don’t bother me as much, and if there was an approval system for who gets them/what they can be I probably wouldn’t care if other users had them as well. I dislike animated avatars though, they get distracting.

Read full topic

item.title: Question need to be answered
item.dc:creator: @RSCShadow RSCShadow
item.description:
@RSCShadow wrote:

Maybe if you have a certain post count, no warnings etc., etc. you could have an image in your sig? Iunno

item.description:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:14, topic:419857”][quote author=judostar1 link=topic=522394.msg3798851#msg3798851 date=1319856761]

Been suggested before, kind of like avatars, it’ll make the page load slower and would be hard to maintain (pornography, gore, etc.), and as said above, it looks sloppy.

wasn’t a suggestion though, it was a question.
[/quote]

and now you have your answer. :P[/quote]

thank you chassy.
